{{Infobox military person | name = Pyotr Ivanovich Kuznetsov | native_name = Пётр Иванович Кузнецов | birth_date = {{birth date|1925|1|30|df=y}} | death_date = {{death date and age|1981|5|14|1925|1|30|df=y}} | birth_place = Zelony Luzhok village, [[Suvorovsky District]], [[Tula Oblast]], [[RSFSR]], [[Soviet Union]] | death_place = [[Kaluga]] | serviceyears = 1942–43 | rank = [[Junior Sergeant]] | unit = [[3rd Guards Airborne Division]] | battles = [[World War II]] *[[Battle of Kiev (1943)]] | awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Order of Lenin}} }}'''Pyotr Ivanovich Kuznetsov''' ([[Russian language|Russian]]: Пётр Иванович Кузнецов; 30 January 1925 – 14 May 1981) was a [[Red Army]] [[junior sergeant]] during [[World War II]] and a [[Hero of the Soviet Union]].<ref name=":0">{{cite book|editor1-last=Shkadov|editor1-first=Ivan|title=Герои Советского Союза: Краткий биографический словарь|date=1987|publisher=Voenizdat|location=Moscow|url=http://az-libr.ru/index.htm?Persons&000/Src/0007/20196e08|language=Russian|trans-title=Heroes of the Soviet Union: A Brief Biographical Dictionary|volume=1 Abaev-Lubitsch}}</ref> Kuznetsov was awarded the title for his actions in the 1943 [[Battle of Kiev (1943)|Battle of Kiev]], where he reportedly killed 41 German soldiers. He was seriously wounded and discharged soon after. After the war, Kuznetsov lived in [[Kaluga]].
== Early life == Kuznetsov was born 30 January 1925 in the village of Zelony Luzhok in the [[Suvorovsky District]] of [[Tula Oblast]] to a peasant family. After graduating from seventh grade, he worked on a [[Collective farming|collective farm]].<ref name=":2">{{Ruheroes|id = 22456|name = Pyotr Ivanovich Kuznetsov}}</ref><ref name=":0" />
== World War II == Kuznetsov was drafted in 1942. He was sent to the 2nd Guards Airborne Regiment in the [[3rd Guards Airborne Division]] in 1943. Kuznetsov became a squad leader in the regiment's 2nd Battalion with the rank of junior sergeant.<ref name=":2" />
He fought in the [[Battle of Kiev (1943)|Battle of Kiev]] in October, his first battle. On 6 October 1943, near the village of Gubin in [[Chernobyl Raion]], Kuznetsov reportedly rushed into a German trench with his squad. He then reportedly bayoneted a machine gun crew, turned it around and opened fire on the German soldiers,<ref name=":0" /> reportedly killing 32 soldiers and an officer. The German troops soon counterattacked and Kuznetsov reportedly repulsed it by throwing two grenades, reportedly killing six German soldiers. In the ensuing hand-to-hand fighting, he reportedly bayoneted another two soldiers but was wounded.<ref name=":1">Hero of the Soviet Union citation, available online at [https://pamyatnaroda.mil.ru/heroes/podvig-chelovek_nagrazhdenie150018095/ pamyatnaroda.mil.ru]</ref> In a later battle, he was severely wounded and discharged in late 1943.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":2" />
He was awarded the title [[Hero of the Soviet Union]] on 10 January 1944 for his actions, along with the [[Order of Lenin]].<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" />
== After the war == He lived in [[Kaluga]] and died on 14 May 1981.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":0" />
